title.rendered: When The Going Gets Tough…, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,
2Timothy 2:1-13, vs. 3, “2 ..You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ”
The epistle of 2 Timothy are the final words of the great apostle Paul to his own son in the faith, Timothy. It’s an exhortation for Timothy to stand strong in the face of insurmountable difficulties ahead. As the final writing of Paul, it is tender, sympathetic, tearful, and yet heroic and stately. Paul is preparing his young son Timothy for the perilous times as a believer, as a pastor, as a son, as a citizen, as a brother.

Three times in 2 Timothy the note of suffering hardship is mentioned (1:8; 2:3; 4:5), indicating the need for Timothy’s encouragement. Paul instructs Timothy to be a “good soldier of Christ Jesus” (2:3). The whole tenor of the epistle is a note of encouragement and who better to encourage Timothy than an aged warrior who was about to die. Of all the people, I have read in the bible, I only know of Paul, who understood clearly what  awaited  him in the future for the sake of the call. Right at his conversion in Acts 9, we are told, “15. But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen vessel of Mine to bear My name before Gentiles, kings, and the children of Israel. 16 For I will show him how many things he must suffer for My name’s sake.” The other well known person we know that bore the  “must suffer” was our Lord Jesus Christ. Paul was in God’s will and suffering was part of God’s sovereign plan for his life. God had a wonderful plan for Paul’s life, listen to that plan, “except that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that chains and tribulations await me.” Acts 20:23

Vehicles  have shock absorbers for a reason, the makers prepared them for potholes they may encounter in the future. What do shock absorbers do, in a vehicle it reduces the effect of traveling over rough ground, leading to improved ride quality, and increase in comfort due to substantially reduced amplitude of disturbances. Without shock absorbers, the vehicle would have a bouncing ride. Have you ever driven on a highway or any road that was so smooth then out of nowhere you hit a pot hole? These are the reasons the vehicles have shock absorbers to prepare you and the car for what is to come hence reduce the impact and the damage.

Paul had his shock absorbers on from day one, and here we see him helping Timothy get his own shock absorbers while also preparing others too.  Paul accepted the call knowing what was a head of him.  As “Must suffer” may not be for us, we know as believers, we are not exempt. We are praying and hoping that we don’t but God’s sovereign will must prevail for His own glory.  I trust for change but if He has to take me through a different road, I ask for grace and strength to stand and endure. It’s hard to pray Thy will be done. Those who can boldly pray Thy will be done are those who have already prayed Thy kingdom come. I ask for my shock absorbers for the potholes in this journey of  life. On my own I’m un able, I don’t know how I would make it without His grace. In the next few devotions, I will pick out three things Paul encouraged Timothy with as he would face hardship in his journey ahead. Begin to seek God to prepare you for the days, years to come. The road may get bumpy, you may hit potholes with your job, family, marriage, children. I hope I’m not scaring you, that’s not my intention. A good general will prepare his troops for the battle a head. “Good preparation is service”, I did not know that till I heard Paris Reidhead say it.  To continue. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: When The Going Gets Tough…, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Timothy 2:1-13, vs. 3, “2 ..You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ”

At the beginning of each year as I turn on Christian TV, I always hear things such as “this is the year of favor”, “God has promised to do something spectacular in your life this new year” among many promises. While listening, not always do all these things come to pass. We are sometimes promised things that Jesus never promised believers. We then come to another new year and the cycle of promises continues. With many episodes of things, we’ve experienced as a family and no doubt you’ve had your own experiences, do we ever sit and wonder whether we are fire proofed for the perilous times to come?

Jesus warned of difficult days a head, read Matthew 24, for instance. To our shame as servants of the Lord, we’ve prepped believers for blessings, but rarely have we taken time to prepare believers for difficult times ahead. If you’ve realized, the world is not changing for better, it’s getting worse and worse, getting darker and scary and as believers we had better get ready for those difficult times. Someone once said, “tough times don’t last, tough people do”. While the difficult times may not spare His children, God is going to require His children to shine brighter in the midst of difficult times, and I believe that, unless His children prepare or are prepared for those times, many will crumble.

In response to what we are facing, I came across a pamphlet that left me thinking about preparation for a snow storm. You know some of the good tips they give, they say begin by filling your cars with gasoline. This may save your life if you’re in your car and end up stuck in the snow. Keep a blanket, water, food, a little bit of sand and shovel in your car at all times, this will come in handy if you get stuck in the snow. Even if you can’t dig yourself out, the blanket, food and water will sustain you until help arrives. Charge the cell phone. You may lose home phone service during a snow storm, and you’ll need your cell phone battery charged to call for help in the event of an emergency. Go food shopping, get plenty of non-perishables ready-to-eat food, store water you will want one gallon of water per person per day. Get plenty of firewood! You’ll need dry firewood as a heat source in the event that you loose power during the snow storm. Some winter storms – ice storms, especially – can result in power outages that last days, sometimes more than a week!. You don’t need to prepare if there is no storm a head, but if there is, you owe it to your good senses to pay attention.

To point out, these are more than good suggestions, they are preparation to make you comfortable in the storm to come (mark that I am not using the word happy). To be caught unaware and unprepared in the storm is deadly and so is being unprepared in our spiritual walk. While what I mentioned above are physical preparations, as a believer we need to be spiritually ready. We had better be like the 5 wise virgins who had oil in their lamps burning even at midnight when the groom arrived. We better be ready to have our lamps burning brighter in the midst of the storm, wind etc. to continue…Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Philippians 4:11, “…, for I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content”

I always find it exciting when I discover something new. Electronics always fascinate me. When I discover more of what they can do than what I anticipated it brings a smile on my face. Of course there are times I have had something for so long, limited its use because I did not know it could do more and I wondered why I didn’t  discover this ahead of time, I could have made use of it long time ago. We as Christians also know what we can do and are capable of but we do not stretch ourselves to our maximum potential.

You and I cannot know what we are made of until we try things for ourselves. The reason why I have discovered more of what some gadgets could do was by trying. Yes there are times they broke but there are those times they worked even better and I rejoiced. We have people in our congregations that do not know what they are made of and for that reason, they have never learnt the art of trying things out to know what has been deposited in them or they have overlooked what they have and dismissed it as something of no use. David had no problem trying things out and learning what he was made of. He ran after the bear and killed it and so was the lion. Facing Goliath was nothing to him, he knew whose he belonged to therefore, he added faith to what he was about to do and stepped out to do it. That was his key to victory. This is the reason why I believe when he was being anointed the next king, there is no hint of him saying he did not feel able. I believe it’s hard to unlock the hidden treasures without stepping out and trying them.

Paul writing to the Philippians in chapter 4 talks about their generosity towards him. The Philippians church was one of the churches that supported Paul’s ministry and right from the beginning; Paul had tried some things and learnt what he was made of. He had survived ship wrecks, had been stoned and left for dead, worked (made tents) and did ministry at the same time, he made long  journeys, I believe at times he went without and this is what he unlocked in all that he dealt with, “contentment”. Something he could not unlock unless he stepped out. He says, “I have learnt” not by sitting in class, or observing but by doing. He says, “12 I know how to be abased, and I know how to abound. Everywhere and in all things I have learned both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need. 13 I can do all things through Christ] who strengthens me“. He had a tank of survival opened up when he was facing good times and tough times. Had he not tried and faced these things, for sure he would have not learnt. I know that God gives calling to His people and I also believe God reveals what you are made of as you step out. Stepping out allows you to unlock hidden mysteries He deposited in you. I am a witness to this, I never knew what I was made of until I began to exercise faith, stepped out, and did what I was supposed to do. This ministry was birthed in stepping out. I never knew God could use me with all my limitations but when I stepped out, I unlocked a tank of writing and putting messages together He had reserved for the right time. In stepping out by faith, I applied pressure to a container of treasures stored and pushed out what was stored in there. Shake a bottle of soda then try and open it and see pressure at work. Some of us need some shaking to produce pressure that will push out what is locked in us. In this ministry there are hidden treasures of preaching, teaching, parenting, leadership, encouragements etc inside of you that are yet to be unlocked, what are you doing to unlock what God has deposited in you? Do you know what you are made of? Christ in you, the hope of glory.  Don’t wait till you know (might take a while or not show up), step out and try that you may know. You will be amazed to learn something new about what you are made off. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: The Fruit of Continually Trusting God, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But I will hope continually, and will yet praise you more and more.  My mouth shall show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.” (Psalm 71:14-15)

What are some things that you do consistently?  Perhaps you go to work, eat, sleep, pray, read God’s Word, go through your daily routine, or read these devotions.  Your daily routines are done continuously for a purpose.  For example you continually go to work so you can get paid and have enough finances to meet your needs.  Many people do certain things continually that are focused on “their kingdoms.” However when it comes the Kingdom of God do you see a continual pattern in your life, seeking His Kingdom?  The elderly Psalmist reflects upon his life and writes, “But I will hope continually.”  This is indeed trust.  Solomon in his wisdom instructs all to “Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.” Proverbs 3:5 This is something which we are to do continually, and there is a rich promise attached to our diligence to adhere to the proverb.  The Psalmist continues with his continual hope in the Lord which results in praising Him more and more.  When one continually hopes in the Lord, and acknowledges Him continually, one will see the Hand of the Lord making his or her paths straight.  Just stay on the straight and narrow path, is a saying that I imagine you’ve heard.  When one sees God making one’s life to walk on the straight and narrow, praise erupts and then more praise follows.

Do you continually spend time with God, or continually “forget” or spend time with other things, people, and activities?  You will spend your time continually in one way or another, but can the Body of Christ and the Lord see your life and one continually centered on God?  That doesn’t mean that one need stay in their home everyday and pray and read God’s Word.  However it does mean that we continually, daily read His Word, because how can one say one is trusting in God unless one is in His Word?  After the praise more and more is expressed toward the Lord, more erupts from our lips.  The Psalmist experience proclaimed, “My mouth shall show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.” Because He was hoping continually, and seeing God’s Hand guiding his path, he praised the Lord more and more, and then he had to tell others.  We too are to tell, about God’s righteousness, that He is a constant, unchanging source of truth worthy of all our praises.  Do you talk to others about the great things God is saying to you, showing you, doing in your life or is that only for “church?”  We shouldn’t be concerned with the world’s notion that “religion and politics” should not be discussed at a table.  If a Yankee fan hoots and hollers at a game no one thinks it strange, but when a Christian is excited about God suddenly that Christian is a “fanatic.”  Do you see the inconsistency with the world?  God is consistent and calls us to be consistent with Him, and to show that consistency to others.  The Psalmist concludes saying that he would show forth the salvation of God all the day, because he knows not the numbers thereof.  One thing one can never do in heaven is evangelize the lost, because no lost, unsaved person will be there. Are you proclaiming the salvation of the Lord to others?  Most Christians talk to other Christians about the Lord and neglect those whom Christ called us to reach, the lost.  If we trust God then why are we not continually spending time with Him, continually trusting, praising, and sharing our faith with the lost?  Remember it all starts with time but continues with hope, praise and sharing our faith.  Are you consistent?  If not today make a u-turn and start fresh, because God allows u-turn, its called repentance.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 11:44, “And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with grave clothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin”

You may have read the story of Lazarus who was brought back to life. This was a man close to Jesus, loved by Jesus and was a friend of Jesus. While Jesus was away one time, Lazarus became gravely ill and we are told he died. I don’t want to dwell on what happened from the time that he died to the time that Jesus calls him out of the grave, I want to dwell on the his condition when he came out of the grave having been made alive. Jesus came to make dead people live, that is salvation a clear picture demonstrated through dead Lazarus brought back to life. This marks the beginning of living,

Lazarus is brought back to life but there is one little problem to address, he is bound by grave clothes. The clothes they buried him in coiled around him like a band aid. He could not move far, see, breathe well, hear well or even stand steadily. It’s amazing that the voice of the Lord cut through icy cold wrapped up dead body to give life but when he came out he was bound. Yes he was a live but still had issues to deal with. Is this not true even for a believer who is newly saved or been saved for sometime meaning brought back to life but still bound by grave clothes in other words still got things to deal with like the world, temper, language, attitudes, ungodly appetites, bad character to mention a few. When you were dead in sin, there was no battle to face, brought back to life makes everything else a  battle. It does not mean that you are not alive, Christ lives in you but you are bound by grave clothes. Salvation is not the end, it’s the beginning of growth. It’s the beginning of getting out of the grave clothes, it’s the beginning of being set free for the Spirit is loosed, the mind is being loosed and the body shall be loosed. Even Lazarus’ restoration took time from the stones being removed, to Jesus calling him out of the grave so that he could be free. We too are all called into freedom for the bible says that, “whoever the Son set’s free is free indeed” but we have to understand it’s a process. This is part of growing in holiness, getting loosed day by day, and removing heavy layers day by day.

The man who was once dead and now alive could not free himself, Jesus had to speak a word, “Loose him and let him go”. I still find that I’m bound by some grave clothes and I need to be free. I need Him to speak  His word in my life this morning to be free. I am tired of being bound by the grave clothes, I want to completely be done hanging around the tombs. Living people don’t live in the cemetery. Are you hanging around the tombs, are you bound by the grave clothes struggling to be free? you have to want freedom for Him to speak this  word, “Loose him and let him go”. Blessings, Ev

title.rendered: Who are you in the Kingdom of God? By Brother Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“My people are destroyed for of lack of knowledge (in other words because of ignorance): Because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee….” (Hosea 4:6)

What you don’t know can destroy you or deprive you of what is rightfully yours. Ignorance has no defense, someone once said.

Today, I would like to expose you to some fundamental biblical knowledge (truth) to meditate on that will help you understand and know your true self (person). Knowing who you are and whose you are is the key to your rightful position and possessions in the kingdom of God. Your life cannot be meaningful, happy, satisfying and complete in this world without you fully understanding, from the Bible’s point of view, what God has done for you; what position God has put you and; what possessions you are entitled to as a child of God. God’s children have rights, privileges, favors, and blessings that are not available to everybody.

Who are you in the Kingdom of God? What is your relationship with God? If you don’t have a relationship with God, you don’t have a right to any of his blessings.

If you are born again, then you are a child of God. You have been empowered to be a bon-fide, legitimate child of God. God’s blood is running in your veins and any spiritual DNA test will reveal that you have a relationship with Christ. The Bible confirms that.

“He came to his own, and his own received him not. But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name. Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God. (John 1:11-13)

“Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord and Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy has begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead….” (1Peter 1:3)  The new relationship is a favor, privilege, blessing and honor that God has extended to all of us who were ones nothing but sinners destined for hell. For all have sinned and fallen short of God’s glory (Romans 3:23).

But he has chosen you and translated you from servant-hood to sonship. Jesus said to his disciples whom he had empowered to become children of God just like you and I,

“…Hence forth I call you not servants; for the servant does not know what his Lord does;…Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you and ordained YOU ….” (John 15:15-16)

Rise up today; think, walk, talk, act and live like a true child of God. Forget about your temporary misery, problems, challenges or lack. You have everything in Christ. Let not the lies of Satan confuse you. Stand and declare what is written. Praise God and rejoice over your new relationship with Him. Amen! God bless you. blessings Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jeremiah 1:9, Then the LORD reached out his hand and touched my mouth and said to me, “Now, I have put my words in your mouth. 10 See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant, (NIV)

To trust God daily is an indication you are not satisfied where you are. It does not mean you are not content, it means you are opened to everything the Lord would want to do in your life for His glory. So you trust God to do spectacular things as you are in the expectation mode. We all have things we are expecting from the Lord and we are placing it all in God’s able hands to see us through as we move to greater dimensions. I don’t know about you but I am expecting God to teach me to thrive.

When God called Jeremiah, He had something great stored for him. Jeremiah did not even know about it but God did. God designed him for a job He had set aside till the right time. The first encouragement God gives him Jeremiah 1:5, “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; Before you were born I sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet to the nations.” Do you know that God did not have an idea of what to do with your life after He made you? He made you because He had an idea of what to do with your life. Four things for our process, 1. God knew us, 2. Formed us, 3. Sanctified us, then 4. Ordained us. Mark the order because the order is important. In every step you see God (knowing, forming, sanctifying, ordaining). Everything and every step changes but God, The only way Jeremiah would thrive was going through the changes in the hands of God who changes not. God knows us better than we know ourselves and what we feel we are not able to do because of what we think of ourselves does not change His plan for our destiny. You may say like Jeremiah, “I cannot speak because I am a child (weak, immature)”. Hear what the Lord is saying in verse 7, “do not say, “I’m only a child”(NIV), in other words, don’t speak about what you think yourself though true, speak of what I have told you about yourself. If we are going to thrive, we have to set aside what we think and feel about ourselves to operate on what God has told us about us in His WORD. If we can grasp this concept, then we are ready for the next move of God. Vs 9 “Then the LORD reached out His hand and touched my mouth and said to me, “Now, I have put my words in your mouth”. God took him from what he thought of himself to how He knew, formed, sanctified and ordained him to be. He then empowered him by placing His words in Him through touching his mouth. The next move, 10 See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant, (NIV). Who can be appointed if they have nothing in them to accompany that appointment? God has empowered us through His word then appointed us for a task that requires that empowerment. To thrive we will have to uproot, tear, destroy and overthrow everything that try’s to set itself high against the knowledge God has placed in us about us. Anything that tries to go above what God has told us about us has to go for they are a hindrance to our building and planting. He has given us the power to uproot, tear, destroy, overthrow, build and plant. We can thrive because He is teaching us how to.

Let this year be a year that we all thrive to greater levels as we say, “Lord hold us close and teach us so that we can thrive”. We want to make steady progress, we want to prosper, we want to flourish, and we want to grow stronger because all these are what thriving means. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Thriving on God’s Promises, By Brother Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Let me begin by asking you a question, “Have you ever made a promise and failed to keep it?”

I have  countless times. We all have. There is no person living on earth who has not failed to keep a promise. All of us are “promise failures”.

But, there is only one, I mean one, “promise keeper” who has not, cannot and will never fail to keep his promises. And that is the Lord, God Almighty, our Heavenly Father. He is a faithful “promise maker and keeper”.

In the Bible, from Genesis to Revelation, God has made very special promises to His people which he has fulfilled throughout all generations. The Bible clearly gives us reasons why His promises cannot fail. One of them to focus on today is,

“For the promises of God in Him are YES, and in Him Amen….” (2 Cor. 1:20)
Note, only the promises of God that are in Him are guaranteed. There is no but or may be. God always gives His promises with a very strong emphasis of assurance “I will….”

Have you claimed any promise or promises of God and failed to receive? I have many times. Does that mean that God failed? No. There could be several reasons why you and I fail to receive God’s promises. However, there are four major reasons why you will fail to receive.

1.) You don’t know the promises. God has a promise to take care of you in every situation. He has said that He will provide all your needs; that He will deliver you from all your afflictions,” Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but God delivers them from them all”.(Psalms 34:19); that He will not fail you; that He will heal, strengthen, protect, promote you; that He will never fail you or let you be a shamed; that if you call on Him He will answer and do to you great and mighty things you have not known or imagined (Jeremiah 33:1, 32:27). The list goes on. Are you aware of the specific promises for your specific problems and needs? Go to the Manual-the Bible and find out.

2.) You have not claimed the promises. God’s promises are to be claimed. Just like you must present a check to the bank to claim promised cash, likewise you must identify God’s promise and claim it. He says, “Ask it shall be given you. You don’t ask, you don’t get.

3.) You don’t believe the promise. Knowing and asking without believing the promise and trusting that God will honor the promise will not do you any good. A lot of people make a lot of claims in their prayers, but don’t believe what they are claiming is possible. If you don’t believe, you cannot receive.

4.) You don’t wait for God to fulfill His promises His way in His time. Impatience can be very costly. Waiting is the hardest thing for many of us and impatience is one of the major hindrances to fulfillment to God’s promises.  After you have claimed God’s promise, you better be prepared to wait until….God cannot let you down. People will let you down but God will lift you up. Your circumstances will tear you a part but God will put your torn pieces  together. You can never fail or falter if you make a claim that is good, acceptable and is perfect will of God, rest assured that God will fulfill His WORD. (Romans 12:1-2)

There are two very obvious observations you will make when reading your Bible, 1) that it is a book that has real life stories of men and women, families, nations, prophets, disciples, kings and rulers, young men and old men, who loved God with all their hearts and worshipped Him in truth and the Holy Ghost, but who were all greatly afflicted by all kinds of afflictions, 2) that is a Great Book full of God’s promises and  that God faithfully fulfilled those promises in the lives of all those who claimed them in their afflictions.

Thriving on God’s Promises, God is a promise keeping God. What He promises you, He will do even when you are not faithful in keeping your promise to Him. The Bible is sacred book from your heavenly father. It is the source of God’s promises to you. From Genesis to Revelation, God declares, at times, solemnly what He will do without fail. One thing is sure, He has promised to deliver the righteous from, “all their afflictions.”

“Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but God delivers them from them all”.(Psalms 34:19)

Rise up, study the promises, claim them, believe them, and wait upon God. Stand still and you will see the salvation of the Lord (Exodus 14:13) Rejoice for all things are yours for today, not tomorrow. It is your day of blessings. May God bless and keep you. blessings Brother Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 11:4, “By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and through it he being dead still speaks”.

We constantly meet people who refer to themselves as spiritual or religious. Most serve a god in their making, a god they are more comfortable with instead of serving the Living God. People try to offer their very best to God, question is, is it ever good enough.

In Genesis 4, brothers, Cain and Abel, one time brought sacrifices before God, Genesis 4: ﻿3﻿And ﻿﻿in the process of time it came to pass that Cain brought an offering of the fruit of the ground to the Lord. ﻿4﻿ Abel also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of their fat. And the Lord ﻿﻿respected Abel and his offering”. They both brought what they felt was acceptable to God, If, “Faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God”, Romans 10:17, they must have known what the Lord required of them. We see Cain bringing fruit of the ground. Now the ground was cursed in Genesis 3 and here he is trying to make something for himself, in his own effort, and he brings it to the Lord (works). On the other hand, Abel offers to God “the firstborn of his flock and of their fat”. He is offering to God what is from God, a lamb. God honored his sacrifice. Hebrews 11:4 gives us the reason God honored his sacrifice, he offered it by faith.  His sacrifice by faith was counted to him as righteousness.

It’s the saving faith that honors God a receiving from us what is from Him. What can we offer God on our own that is good enough? nothing. Hasn’t the bible said already in Romans 3:20, “Therefore by the deeds of the law no flesh will be justified in His sight”. That in as much as we offer to God the offering from the ground, something we have worked, what we are comfortable with, our accomplishments, it’s never good enough. God requires a perfect sacrifice. To offer a sacrifice from the fruit of the ground is not to offer a perfect excellent sacrifice. We all fall short. We need to offer to God a perfect sacrifice and He is the only One who can give that perfect sacrifice. And He did, He gave His Only begotten Son to suffer and die for our sins. And by repentance and faith, we can offer to God Christ (the firstborn (position), first fruit) who offered Himself as the Lamb, the blood sacrifice to  save us. Revelation 1:4-6, “4 …Grace to you and peace from Him who is and who was and who is to come, and from the seven Spirits who are before His throne, 5 and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler over the kings of the earth. To Him who loved us and washed us from our sins in His own blood, 6 and has made us kings and priests to His God and Father, to Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.  He is the more excellent sacrifice.”

Galatians 3:11, “But that no one is justified by the law in the sight of God is evident, for “the just shall live by faith.” a different bible version puts it this way, “he who is righteous by faith shall live.”  God demands His requirements be met in His way. Ritual in itself never satisfies God and is an abomination to Him.  If you are trying to get saved by  good works “fruit of the ground”, then you’ve disqualified yourself like Cain. What God has commanded in the law (ten commandments), He has provided in the gospel of His Son Jesus and for you and I to satisfy the demands of the law, we have to abandon our sins, turn away from them and receive Christ as the Lamb of God to wash away our sins. Have you repented of your sins?, are you counting on your “fruit of the ground” to save you?, what you are counting on may be the very thing that will condemn you. “By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and through it he being dead still speaks”, Hebrews 11:4, Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Joshua 7:﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11 Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff.”

Temptations in our time are on the loose running wild; God’s standard has not and will never will be lowered. We have to get on with His program and it’s only through Him we can overcome. Romans 13:14, “But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill its lusts.” The age of grace is tougher if you think about it. Living for God is much harder than dying for God in my opinion. When you think you’ve mastered Christianity, like Isaiah you are confronted with the Holiness of God that reduces you to nothing. And with one voice you cry out to God, “be merciful to me a sinner”

In conclusion, Achan and his family with his belongings were stoned. You may ask, why destroy others who do not appear to have sinned? I think they participated in hiding the accursed things. It started with Achan who brought his family into it and brought about destruction. Not too long ago I was told of a believer who promised to leave his wife if she wouldn’t abort her baby. And because she did not want to be abandoned, she aborted, taking a life. Oh how we would not take accursed things and lead others to be part of what we may do and destroy their lives too. It’s not easy to go down alone but we have to be careful not to destroy other people’s lives especially those whom we love. This puts more fear in me to walk a walk worthy of God.

Achan’s personal sin in taking of the accursed thing brought about the deaths of thirty-six innocent Israelite soldiers. Perhaps the most terrifying thing about sin is that there is no such thing as private sin. All sin affects others; the personal sin of Achan kindled the anger of God against Israel. The personal sin of believers always affects the church at large. Every sin involves society; and since each of us makes up society, every sin affects us.

 Vs 25, “Then Joshua said to Achan, “Why have you brought trouble on us? The Lord will now bring trouble on you.” By one man’s sin, God was made to look bad, Joshua questioned God’s promises, victory was delayed, men’s lives (husbands, sons) were lost in battle, he caused his family to be destroyed, he troubled Israel.

Living righteously consistently is the only acceptable life-style. Let’s glean some truths to help us in this journey in James 1:, “12 Blessed is the man who endures temptation; for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life which the Lord has promised to those who love Him. 13 Let no one say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God”; for God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He Himself tempt anyone. 14 But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own desires and enticed. 15 Then, when desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is full-grown, brings forth death.  16 Do not be deceived, my beloved brethren. 17 Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow of turning. 18 Of His own will He brought us forth by the word of truth, that we might be a kind of first fruits of His creatures… 21 Therefore lay aside all filthiness and overflow of wickedness, and receive with meekness the implanted word, WHICH IS ABLE TO SAVE YOUR SOULS. 22 But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves. 23 For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man observing his natural face in a mirror; 24 for he observes himself, goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was. 25 BUT HE WHO LOOKS INTO THE PERFECT LAW OF LIBERTY AND CONTINUES IN IT, AND IS NOT A FORGETFUL HEARER BUT A DOER OF THE WORK, THIS ONE WILL BE BLESSED IN WHAT HE DOES.   Accursed things are pleasures for a season. The end result? trouble for a long time. May the Lord help us live faithfully for Him in the midst of trials and temptations. Blessings, Ev

Good morning,
Would like to introduce brother Ben as he shares devotion with us inline with what I’ve been sharing for the last few days. I met Ben here at GE several months ago through a friend (newly saved) and I’ve truly been blessed by his ministry. God always sends people my way who challenge my walk and Ben is one of those guys. He is passionate about the Lord, wants to live for God’s glory, witness to people and see God save them. He is a blessing and I believe this message will be more than a blessing but a challenge.

Also, morning devotions ministry will be celebrating it’s 8 anniversary on the 02/27, To God be the glory this far He has brought us. As we have done over the years, I will be sharing testimonies I’ve received from people how different messages has impacted them. If you would like to share a testimony, please don’t hesitate to email me, send it to evipooh@gmail.com.

Here is the message by Ben

Good morning,
I Thessalonians 4:7-8- For God did not call us to uncleanness, but in holiness. Therefore he who rejects this does not reject man, but God, who has also given us His Holy Spirit.

I would like to share with you each this morning about God’s call for each of our lives.  Many Christians today run about to try and decipher what God’s call is for their life. They go to conferences, they read books, and they even ask for prayer, when all the while it has been spelled out quite plainly for us, here by the Apostle Paul, we are called to holiness. Holiness is a divine attribute, it is THE divine attribute. If you look at Leviticus 11:44-45, God himself states that He is holy, and that we too ought to be holy. I believe all of God’s invisible attributes are summed up in holiness.  Holiness is shunned by most today, for it comes at a great cost, it will cost you your life, your identity, your reputation, and maybe your friends, but it is to be most desired for it is commanded of us by our God, and to truly love him is to keep His commands, and be assured, it is as much a command as “Thou shalt not kill.” Important to note here is that this is not merely an outward holiness. Reading the Bible, going to church, praying, and evangelizing do not make a man holy. It is one’s heart made pure by the baptism of the Holy Spirit, becoming as Hebrews states, “partakers of HIS holiness.” We truly become HOLY AS HE IS HOLY, partakers of His divine nature. And this transformation comes as we allow God to chasten us, willingly yielding ourselves to Him, being passed through the refining fire, that all the impurities of the carnal nature may be removed. There is a deeper cleansing that God desires to do in each of us, for it is His will for each of us is that we would be sanctified (I Thessalonians 4:3), which means to be set apart and made holy. And, as Paul states in our text, to reject this call is not to reject men, but it is to reject the very command of God, who has given us His Holy Spirit, the promise of the Father, sent to dwell in the hearts of men, to make them pure, and keep them pure. For years I only felt that I could go so far in Christ, like I was always hitting this wall, then falling back a bit, then hitting the wall again, and so on and so forth. Then one day God began to speak to places in my heart through a very dear friend that He never had before. I started to see things I had never seen before that lived in me. Secret spiritual pride, the fear of men, an unteachable spirit, all these things dwelt deep within me, and as I began to see myself in God’s eyes, I began to see who I really was, and I was undone, and it was at this place that God’s true and lasting work in my life began. He removed from me all of these things, and filled my heart with perfect love for Him alone, and He desires that each would possess what Charles Wesley sang about, a “heart to praise my God, a heart from sin set FREE,” So the question is extended to each one, will you heed this call? Will you give up control of your life? Will you lay aside whatever it is you are doing, will you shut off the TV or the movie, and by faith seek God and the baptism of his Holy Spirit? Ephesians 1:4 says that God chose us, those who would believe on Him by faith, “before the foundation of the world to be holy and without blame before Him in love.” I Peter 1:3 tells us that “His divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness,” God has given us everything we need, we just need to give ourselves entirely to Him, nothing held back, and allow Him to show us our hearts, we must die to our opinion of ourselves, that we might “reckon ourselves dead indeed unto sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord” presenting ourselves as “slaves of righteousness for holiness.” Lastly, in Romans 12:1 Paul writes we are to “present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.” To give ourselves wholly to Him is our reasonable service, it is the least we can do. Matthew 23:19 says it is the “altar that sanctifies the gift.” Christ is the altar, we are the gift. We lay our lives down upon the merits of His sacrifice, and he purifies us, He gives us worth, never the other way around. Without Him we are nothing. I thank you for allowing me to share with you, may God bless you each richly as you pursue Him with all you heart. – Brother Ben

Good morning,
Joshua 7:﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11 Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff.”

We have a three fold enemy we battle, the world, the flesh and the devil. They bring about, 1 John 2:16, “…the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life”, This is what brought about the downfall of Achan.

We finally get to Achan to find out what he did and how that is relevant to us today, Joshua 7:19﻿ Now Joshua said to Achan, “My son, I beg you, ﻿give glory to the Lord God of Israel, ﻿and make confession to Him, and ﻿﻿tell me now what you have done; do not hide it from me.” I pondered on this line, how do you give glory to God in your sin? By coming clean. The bible says, “let God be true and every man a liar”, Romans 3:4. This was the time to prove to everyone that indeed there was sin in the camp and God was not looking for an excuse not to bless the Israelites or punish them for nothing. God delights in those who come clean, a broken heart and a contrite spirit, such He will not deny (Psalm 51). God’s glory will only be reflected back to Him when the life of God’s servant is cleared of guilt. Bishop Patrick(not sure of his last name) quotes the Samaritan chronicle, making Joshua to say here to Achan, Lift up thy eyes to the king of heaven and earth, and acknowledge that nothing can be hidden from Him who knoweth the greatest secrets.

Vs 20, “And Achan answered Joshua and said, “Indeed ﻿I have sinned against the Lord God of Israel, and this is what I have done: ﻿21﻿ When I saw among the spoils a beautiful Babylonian garment, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, I ﻿﻿coveted them and took them. And there they are, hidden in the earth in the midst of my tent, with the silver under it.”, it’s what he saw that he desired, the desire turned into lust and that lust prompted him to act. Doesn’t this sound familiar with Eve in the garden of Eden and David when he saw Bathsheba? And many other stories in the Bible of the same. They all boil down to, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes and the pride of life.

Sin begins with innocent sight, degenerates into lustful desire or covetousness, and falls from there into participation. Temptations are not sins by definition, we are afraid they can lead to sin. And if our Savior was tempted in all manner, there is no way we will escape temptations.

How should a believer be an over comer of the world, the flesh and the devil? be crucified to the world, be mortified to the things, to the affairs and enticements, of it, simply, dead to the world. I constantly pray to die to self and be alive unto Christ. The flesh wants to take over,  I need  to bring it into captivity under the obedience of Christ. 2Corinthians 10:5.  Feed the Spirit more and starve the flesh. Romans 6:12, “Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts.” Galatians 5:1, “I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh. Strive to be alive unto Christ and dead to the world. To finish, blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Joshua 7:﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11 Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff

He whom the Lord loves, He corrects lest He let him run wild. When I look back at the corrections by my parents, I’m glad they did not leave me to do what I wanted, disobey and dishonor their name. Were the chastening painful? of course, were they good for me? Absolutely. David says in Psalm 119:71, “It is good for me that I have been afflicted, That I may learn Your statutes. He that chastened him taught him. The rod and reproof give wisdom. When our heavenly Father chasten us and grants us mercies despite our deliberate disobedience, we stand in awe.

Job 5:17, “Behold, happy is the man whom God corrects; Therefore do not despise the chastening of the Almighty”, Proverbs 3:11, “My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD, Nor detest His correction; Hebrews 12:7, “If you endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; for what son is there whom a father does not chasten? Vs 8 But if you are without chastening, of which all have become partakers, then you are illegitimate and not sons”.

Joshua came in a state of humility and God was gracious to hear his prayer to accomplish what He had began, He says to Joshua vs. 10, “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11 Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them.”  It’s one thing to pray to know what your sin is, it’s another thing to get up and deal with it. Repent and TURN away from it. Many times believers cry to God under conviction for forgiveness, and right after, they go back and fall on the same sins again. To Paraphrase Carter Conlon, “You can’t write off a conviction with a prayer, you must come with a lifestyle of bending your knee to God with a desire to change” . It calls for prayers to know what the sin is and strength to get rid of sin and what is causing you to sin. Hezekiah in 2Kings 18, Asa in 2Chronicles 14, and Gideon in Judges 6 among others destroyed the accursed things, idols. Anything that exalts itself against the knowledge of God is sin and must be destroyed.

What a tremendous lesson for any Christian who experiences defeat. God was fully aware of what had happened. Vs 11 Israel have sinned … for they have even taken some of the accursed thing … they have also put it among their own stuff. God was not looking for excuses, nor a sociological assessment of what caused Israel to sin. God was interested in repentance, confession of sin, and restoration to fellowship. He was fully aware that Israel turned their backs before their enemies, because they were accursed. There was no hiding the problem. If something were not done, the divine response would be devastating: vs. 12, “…neither will I be with you any more, unless you destroy the accursed from among you”

The call to sanctify the people is reminiscent of Joshua 3:5.  “And Joshua said unto the people, Sanctify yourselves: for to morrow the LORD will do wonders among you” God never moves in unclean vessels. If Israel was to be used of God, she had to be purged of her sins.  You want to be anointed and used of God, repent, turn from your sins and hide God’s word in your heart, Psalm 119:9, “How can a young man cleanse his way? By taking heed according to Your word. Vs 10 With my whole heart I have sought You; Oh, let me not wander from Your commandments! 11 Your word I have hidden in my heart That I might not sin against You”,  to continue … BTW, I’m getting challenged more and more in my walk with the Lord as I share on these series, they are more for me. blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Joshua 7:﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11 ﻿Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff”

﻿I think there are people who blame God for not keeping His promises when in actuality, it’s not God’s fault. If anything, we are the ones who make God look bad to the world when we don’t get our acts together. We slow His work because we have sin to deal with. Isaiah 59:1 Behold, the LORD’s hand is not shortened, That it cannot save; Nor His ear heavy, That it cannot hear. 2 But your iniquities have separated you from your God; And your sins have hidden His face from you, So that He will not hear. 2 Peter 3:9, “The Lord is not slack concerning His promise…”

And here we do not see Joshua  blaming God but asking questions concerning His promises vs. 7﻿ And Joshua said, “Alas, Lord ﻿God, ﻿﻿why have You brought this people over the Jordan at all—to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us? Oh, that we had been content, and dwelt on the other side of the Jordan! Don’t you think that it may have run through the mind of the people that God had failed them despite the fact that it was the people, Achan to be specific?

After the initial shock of Israel’s defeat at Ai, Joshua immediately turned his face toward the Lord. His prayer  vs. ﻿8﻿ O Lord, what shall I say when Israel turns its ﻿﻿back before its enemies? ﻿9﻿ For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear it, and surround us, and ﻿cut off our name from the earth. Then ﻿what will You do for Your great name?”, without knowing what had happened, he did not turn to blame the soldiers for not fighting hard or the spies for giving him information that was not helpful. He turned to God knowing that what had happened was way bigger than men. But watch this, his concern was not so much that the men of Ai had evened his record of victories and defeats, he was concerned for the sake of God’s great name. This I believe should be the greatest driving factor to live a holy, righteous life, that we do it for His name sake, Ezekiel 36:21-23, vs.21 But I had concern for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations wherever they went. 22 “…, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I do not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, but for My holy name’s sake, which you have profaned among the nations wherever you went. 23 And I will sanctify My great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst; and the nations shall know that I am the LORD,” says the Lord GOD, “when I am hallowed in you before their eyes.

My greatest desire and I hope it is yours too, is to live a righteous life for His name’s sake. I do not want  people to blaspheme His name because of me. Don’t we see even today how God’s name is blasphemed because of how believers behave (by their lifestyle and  they have no fruit to accompany their claim). David says in Psalm 23: 3, “He restores my soul; He leads me in the paths of righteousness For His name’s sake. Yes there are blessings that come with living a righteous life such as escape from future punishment, things may become a little easy, there can be victories that come because of it , like I mentioned before, we want our righteous living to be for His name’s sake and we pray “Lead us in the paths of righteousness for Your name sake”. We want to want to stay away from the accursed things for His Holy name’s sake and if we have them present, we want to get rid of them for His name sake. To continue…blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Joshua 1: ﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11﻿Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff”

If there is one person who had great assurance from God about life, it was Joshua. Look at God’s promises to him, Joshua 1:3, every place that sole of your foot will tread upon I have given to you, as I said to Moses, vs. 5. No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life; as I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not leave you nor forsake you. vs. 6 be strong and of good courage, vs. 13 the Lord your God is giving you rest and is giving you this land”. What an assurance. He was now ready to lead God’s people who assured him to follow God’s commands given to them. Earlier it was the people that drove Moses to sin; he was tired of their complaint which led him to disobey God. An episode like this was bound to repeat itself under the leadership of Joshua if he was not careful. You can either be living in sin and miss being in God’s will or have people drive you to sin as they did with Moses, ultimately, you are still the one held responsible.

Here we find that although it was Achan who took the accursed thing, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the children of Israel. As Paul regards the Corinthian church to have been polluted by the presence of one single offender 1 Cor 5:2, 6, 7, so all of Israel is polluted by the offense of one named Achan. Could it be possible that if we know that someone is living in sin and we keep quiet and confronts them, we are enabling their sin while disabling God’s  blessings upon us?  For example people taking the name of the Lord in vain, even using it as a curse word but you say nothing.

Look at what happened, right after victory in Jericho, the Israelites move to Ai which was a small city with few people. Those who spied Ai said vs. 3 Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai. They had strategy; God was on their side as they hoped and if God was for and with them, who could be against them Romans 8:31. If they were going to gain victory, God would have to go before them by day as a cloud of wind and by night as pillar of fire. But because of the sin in the camp, God did not go with them. And here we see how a small city defeated the Israelites. The Israelite forces must have been in shock. Their hearts melted, not because of cowardice, but because the strong hand of the Lord, upon which they relied, had apparently been removed from them. Sometimes you are not aware that the presence of the Lord has departed until you find yourself living in defeat. Remember Samson who toyed with sin and when he woke up to go after the enemy did not even know that the presence of God had departed?

This is a very valuable lesson to learn, when you find yourself living in defeat, you want to ask yourself, has the presence of the Lord departed? And if so, is there sin currently present in your life that you have not dealt with or sin in the camp that has not been dealt with. We can be tempted in the midst of victory but to live in victory, 1John 5:4 says, “For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world our faith”. Christ in us is the victory we need. As long as He is present we are overcomers. Our plans and strategies without him will fail miserably and sin disables His presence and  hands upon us. To continue, blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 37:1-8, “Delight yourself also in the Lord, And He shall give you the desires of your heart”

The main word  to address today is the word “COMMIT”. Commit has been defined in the dictionary as to do, perform, to put in trust or charge, entrust, to pledge and many more. Commitment is a struggle to a number of people, commitment to God, marriage, relationship, family, job, church, etc it requires work, effort, struggle to mention a few. I believe that the reason why certain desires are not fulfilled or delayed is because the Lord would bring them to those who are ready to commit.  Some have to be prepared for that desire before they can be entrusted with it. The bible says commit your ways to the Lord, if we can commit our ways to Him, we can commit ourselves to the desire. And just the same way when we commit ourselves to the Lord it requires work, the same way the desires of our heart will require work. Proverbs 3:5, “Trust in the Lord with all thine heart and lean not on thy own understanding, in all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your path”, trusting in the Lord with all our hearts requires commitment to prayers, reading His word, fasting, witnessing, ministering and even reaching out. Those are not easy tasks for they involve surrender, humility, obedience, meekness etc. The secret to receiving God’s direction for your life and mine is being willing to surrender to His will, trusting in Him that He may bring it to pass. When God began to build a desire in me to begin devotion ministry, I knew that it would require work. The first thing was to commit my ways to the Lord and then He fulfilled the desire, but now I have to work hard to maintain that desire and that means many times forgoing certain things to keep the desire alive. I have to pray, fast, read, wake up early to prepare devotions, hear and respond to people simply because I have committed myself to the desire. I am committed to doing this and so whatever it takes, I have purposed in my heart to do it and the more I have committed myself to it, the more the Lord has been gracious to lead, strengthen , bless , encourage  and teach me.  The joy of being able to commit yourself to a desire allows Psalm 37:6 to come in handy for it says “He shall bring forth your righteousness as the light, And your justice as the noonday”. This will cause you to shine and people will see that but they will not know that behind that light, you have committed yourself to the Lord. TO him that much is given, much is expected. Proverbs 16:3, “Commit your works to the Lord, and your thoughts shall be established”. I am committed to bringing to God my ways and my thoughts that I may entrust Him with them everyday.

Psalm 37:7&8, “Rest in the Lord, wait patiently for Him… vs. 8, “Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; do not fret – it only causes harm”. What a blessing to rest in the Lord and patiently wait for Him. All I needed to do was commit myself to bringing my ways and thoughts to Him, the moment I have done that, my worries are over and now I can rest. Resting is the state of having peace inside knowing that someone has control over the situation. Someone once said, God will ask you to push a rock but he does not expect you to move it. The part of pushing is being obedient to His word and being committed to doing it and when you have done your part, let Him do His. Let us wait patiently for Him and not look to any side and see who has made it and who has not for our desires does not come based on someone else’s success or failures, it’s based on delighting ourselves in the Lord, committing, and trusting in Him alone. Do not be angry or stretched out because someone is a head of you, praise God for them and trust God for your desire. Also don’t be angry when someone else is moving to greater levels, at times you don’t know what they have done or gone through to get to  where they are. Some it took many tears, going without, waking up in the cold hours of the night to seek God; some gave up on great things to gain greater things. All that you are seeing is the result but beneath that victory and success, someone was committed to going an extra mile to get where they’ve got. All I have to do is find out what they did to get to where they got and I will do the same to achieve the desires of my heart. There is a song that was written “God will do for you what He has done for others”, that is true but God will not do for you what He has done for others until you have done what others have done to get where they’ve got. The method maybe the same but the results can be different.

So ask yourself this question, are you willing to commit yourself to a desire before and after to work hard to maintain it according to God’s ways? Don’t desire what you are not willing to work for. Blessings Ev

Good morning,

Joshua 1: ﻿10, “So the Lord said to Joshua: “Get up! Why do you lie thus on your face? ﻿11﻿Israel has sinned, and they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them. ﻿For they have even taken some of the accursed things, and have both stolen and deceived; and they have also put it among their own stuff”

In the early chapters of the book of Joshua, God encourages Joshua with these words, “As I was with Moses, so shall I be with you”, we see him gain his first huge victory over Jericho. After dreaming of the promised land for 40 years and tasting victory in Jericho, Israel faces a stunning defeat at Ai which brings Joshua to question things. We will find out why they were defeated when they should have been gaining victory upon victory.

While they were destroying Jericho, a special instructions went out to the people, Joshua 6:18, “And you, ﻿﻿by all means abstain from the accursed things, lest you become accursed when you take of the accursed things, and make the camp of Israel a curse, ﻿﻿and trouble it”, look at the word used “accursed” which is different from “cursed”. The Hebrew word translated “accursed” means to “ban” or “devote. To make the verse clear, Israel was not to take anything from the city of Jericho, for it had been banned by God; and its destruction was devoted as a monument to the omnipotence of Jehovah, the God of Israel.  There were exceptions for a reason to that ban reflected in vs. 19, “…all the silver and gold, and vessels of bronze and iron, are consecrated to the Lord; they ﻿﻿shall come into the treasury of the Lord.” This was a serious violation. Greater victory depended on their obedience to God’s instructions. The beginning of chapter 7 tells us of a man by the name of Achan who took accursed things and the anger of the Lord burned against Israel.

This story will show us how when the things of God are violated, it brings about the anger of the Lord. Our prayer always ought to be, “Lord teach us to fear you more”, the bible says in Proverbs 9:10, “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom”. Where there is no fear of the Lord, people take those things that God has banned and they store it in their lives while hoping that God will continue to bless and keep them.  I believe there are people who are sick right now because they have welcomed things accursed by God in their lives and are unwilling to deal with them. Hatred, rage, unforgiveness, Matthew 6:14, “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. 15 But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses”.  Resentments, jealousies, covetousness etc. Living lifestyles accursed by the Lord insisting to keep living that way while hoping and praying the Lord would overlook it and bless you anyway. It could also be something you are into secretly you hope no one finds out. Yes, you are praying and even have people praying for you like crazy but there is no victory in your life for you have harbored accursed things. Not only is the thing affecting you, it is affecting those around you (family, friends, church). A husband may be praying for victory but not gaining it because he has accursed attitude toward his wife. He has refused to honor his wife God’s way, listen to 1Peter 3:7, “Husbands, likewise, dwell with them with understanding, giving honor to the wife, as to the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered”

Paul gives unexhausted list of accursed things that makes people miss God’s kingdom and God’s blessings, Galatians 5:19, “19 Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lewdness, 20 idolatry, sorcery, hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions, heresies, 21 envy, murders, drunkenness, revelries, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.”, What are you trusting God for? Have you examined whether you have accursed things you are practicing in your life hindering God’s. Check out Paul’s list and see any of the things among others I described above are in your life. To continue, Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 32:28, “And He said, “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have struggled with God and with men, and have prevailed.”

It’s very easy to be crippled by your own opinions about yourself. Some people tend to add salt to this wound you’ve created. Instead of it healing, you inflict more pain to it. You just can’t see living any way better than the way you already know about yourself. Everything God wants to do in your life is assassinated by what you think of yourself. When you have been in a condition for way to long, there is a tendency to throw in the towel and conclude that maybe you were meant to be in this situation forever. Maybe healing and deliverance was not part of God’s plan for your life. If you are dealing with “maybe”, maybe you need to ask yourself, what were you saved from and for? If you don’t understand this well, I guarantee you a defeated life.

I’ve often said that if we’ve been saved by God through faith, we ought to identify with our newly birth. The new man ought to assassinate the old man. The new man needs to understand that the God of heaven had a plan for his life from day one. Jacob operated on what they named him, manipulating his way in life. If anything, he did not see himself being anything different than what he already knew about himself. When God is getting ready to use you, be sure of His dealing with the old man. In the case of Jacob, God asks him his name and what does he tell God, “Jacob”, which means surplanter, deceiver, and conman if I may add. Here comes God ready to use him but He starts dealing with the old man “Jacob” molding him to a new man “Israel”. He struggled with God and men and the bible said he prevailed. If the negative energy was turned into positive energy, how cool will that be? Paul’s strength, teachings, and eloquent speech were turned around by God to be used for His glory after pulling Paul from using these wonderful gifts for evil. Of course we can tell that Jacob was not a quitter, he was a hard worker knew what he desired and went for it. God was about to use these strengths for His glory. At the beginning he was living a lie because of what they called him but when God appeared to him, God showed him who he really was and He called him to be a “Prince”. He identified him with his new birth.

Just to be clear, I am not talking about positive thinking, I’m talking about heavenly living. I am talking about knowing that regardless of your past life and even present situations, you are His own. The blessings He brings in your life are not a result of what you can do but what He can do. I quote this scripture with confidence, 2Timothy 1:12″…for I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day“. I believe this report over someone’s report and mine; I know whom I have believed. I keep killing what he is doing because I speak negative things in my life but let the truth be known. If I continue to believe a lie, eventually I will live a lie. The devil might accuse me of something I did, and sure he may be right but I am not trusting in myself to be what I should be, I am trusting in God who knows what He can do in my life. Why are you living in the “yesterday” when God is telling you to live in the “today?” Your prayer is about what could have happened instead of what can happen now. Rise up today and live like a prince (princess) because you are no longer living a lie. Take this dose and live fully Philippians 4:8, “Finally, brethren, whatever things are true, whatever things are noble, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue and if there is anything praiseworthy–meditate on these things“. Stop living a lie and choose to live fully. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Taken For A Walk, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Gen 5:22 And after he became the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters. Vs. 23 Altogether, Enoch lived 365 years.   Vs. 24 Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.

Do you have spiritual discipline habits?  Did you read your Bible today?  Did you pray today, and not just saying grace or a little bedtime prayer, but a set aside time with God?  Have you shared your faith with someone today?  Perhaps if you have not yet, you will later in the day.  How does one stay consistent in spiritual disciplines?  I believe the life of one not spoken of often, Enoch, lived in such a way that can give us the answer to this question.  God looked upon His servant Enoch and without warning took Enoch to be with Him in Heaven in an instant!  What was it about Enoch that caused God to snatch (or rapture) him up?

  1. 1. Enoch walked with God in agreement.  “The prophet Amos wrote, “Do two walk together unless they have agreed to do so?”  Jesus similarly spoke, “For where two or three come together in my name, there am I with them.”  When one comes to the Lord there must be an agreement of two wills (yours and God’s) becoming one will, God’s.  Some say grandma knows best, but really God knows best.  Paul wrote in Romans 12:2, “Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.”  God’s will is perfect.  He is just waiting for you to align your  will to His, and thus obey His will.  How does this take place?

2.      Enoch delighted himself in God.  “Delight yourself in the LORD and he will give you the desires of your heart” (Psalm 37:4).  When God’s will is your will, you will have your will.  Are you delighted to spend time with your heavenly Father?  Do you spend time with Him?  If you want to get to know someone more intimately you must spend intimate time with them.  Is that true for your relationship with God?

3.      Enoch habitually walked with God.  Anyone can walk with God in agreement, and delight oneself in God for a day, a week, a month.  However at 65 years of age Enoch walked with God, and would do so for the next 300 years of his life!  The amplified version reads, that “Enoch habitually walked with God.”  This was a day–by –day walking with God, talking with God, being with God.  Many only seek God’s hand in times of need, but not God’s face daily in delight for relationship with him.

4.      Enoch’s faith pleased God.  Hebrews 11:15 read, “By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death; he could not be found, because God had taken him away. For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.”

There is no doubt that Enoch habitually delighted himself in God, walked in agreement with God, and had a faith that pleased God so much so that God took Him without warning to be in the Heavens with the Lord.  Enoch was taken for by God for His walk with God.  How is your spiritual life?  Habitual?  Delighted in God?  Does your faith please Him?  When Christ comes to rapture the church will you be taken or left behind?. Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 40:1, “I waited patiently for the LORD; he turned to me and heard my cry. (NIV)

Walking with the Lord is not easy. If you see someone faithfully walking with the Lord it’s not because it’s easier for them than anyone else, it’s because they are determined to walk with the Lord faithfully. It’s in the process of walking with the Lord you realize that His ways are not your ways and His thoughts are not your thoughts, that as high as the heavens is from the earth so are His thoughts and His ways (Paraphrased). This teaches you not to think and deal with God the way you and I would with someone else. Learning His ways and not our ways eliminates frustrations. A thousand years is like a minute to God therefore when you pray and God says wait a minute, it may mean, wait for a while.

To wait on God is to stop dictating God when and how He should do things and let Him be God in your situation. Last time I checked, He wasn’t looking for your opinion and ideas to get things done. His word says Psalm 46:10, “Be still and know that I am God“. If you are going to walk with the Lord, you have to get into His program and not yours.

Psalm 40:1, “I waited patiently for the LORD; he turned to me and heard my cry. (NIV) . David understood a secret that he applied in his life, the secret of patiently waiting for the Lord. Let’s break it down, “I waited“, this deals with time, His timing and not mine. Ecclesiastes 3:11, “He has made everything beautiful in its time“, Learn God’s time. He has divinely implanted sense of a purpose working through the ages which nothing under the sun but God alone can satisfy. Faith and patience go hand in hand, faith is awaiting God’s timing without doubting His love and ability. “Patiently” deals with the process. You are not ready to progress with God without patience as part of God’s process in your life. That’ is what patience is all about. “For the Lord“, the reason behind the waiting. David learnt that everything he had desired of the Lord depended on waiting patiently for the Lord to come through for him and because he mastered it, God turned and heard his cry. Abraham needed to go through the same process, in the middle he felt impatient and tried to answer his own prayer by bringing Ishmael. He felt time was running out of time in relation to how he looked at himself. You know the rest of the story. Think of bringing an Ishmael, God is thinking of bringing an Isaac, the true blessing He has promised his servant.

Last week I celebrated yet another birthday. My birthday week has always been special in the sense I take time to pray and fast, reflecting back where I have come from and trusting God’s leading for the new year. I see how praying and waiting patiently for the Lord to move in different areas has yielded fruits. There are some areas when I look back it felt like I missed my Isaac (true blessing). Nothing was coming forth and thought of settling for Ishmael (man made promise) was very strong. For example, I patiently waited for 8 years to meet and marry the woman of my dreams. It wasn’t the easiest thing to do, at times I felt like I had missed God’s will for my life in that area, at times I felt like I wasn’t doing something right. Days of discouragements were there but I held on to His word waiting for His timing without doubting His love and ability. In His time He blessed me with Judy (we’ve been married now 3 ½ years). I am thankful to God I waited for His true blessing. I know I don’t deserve the best but I always desired the best, God knows how to give the best, I patiently wait for the best. Those who are desiring to meet someone and settle down, don’t give up patiently waiting on God. Don’t doubt His love and ability and most definitely, don’t settle for an Ishmael when God has designed an Isaac for you. One is a true blessing from the Lord, the other is a false blessing made by man. What God gives, He blesses. A final thought, It’s not that the Lord is preparing the blessing for you, the blessing is ready, you are the one who needs preparation for the blessing, that is the difference.  That requires patiently waiting. Blessings Ev
